Decentralize the internet with CDEOS

Powered by EOS

The Problem With Current CDNs

Big market size for CDNS -- Market size graph -- 80% of market => 5 players -- Logos -- Facts: - CDNs are an important part of the UX of internet browsing - CDNs processed more than 50% of the top 10,000 websites (2017)

Solution

-- Diagram of the solution --

Why CDEOS?

1. Content Users - ✓ Seamless browsing exp - ✓ Protection from hacks and phishing - ✓ Control over browsing data and privacy 2. Content publishers - ✓ Cost-effective - ✓ Reduced probability of DDoS attacks - ✓ Strong end-to-end encryption - ✓ Ensures no censorship blocks 3. CDEOS Nodes - ✓ Earn rewards for running CDEOS - ✓ Utilize spare bandwidth and storage capacity

EOS' blockchain will help us execute on this vision

Why EOSIO - EOS is the only platform that can scale to accommodate a large number of low-latency transactions on CDN servers - Interconnectivity with other Blockchains (e.g. IPFS) How is cd.eos different - No solution currently available in the market for decentralized CDNs. - While other platforms address the problem of storage distribution, cd.eos directly solves the problem of utilizing centralized CDN servers with an elegant, feeless and scalable solution What is our objective - Distribute rewards across network participants - Contribute towards a decentralized internet with no censorship - Seamless solution with no How do we grow - The economic incentive provided by cd.EOS attracts a growing number of nodes to participate in the network. - Market price dynamics will automatically make sure that supply and demand of CDN services are matched

So what's next, how do we execute on this vision?

1. Idea generated, working prototype built. (Jun 18) Generated Idea Developed MVP Won 1st Prize @ EOS Hackathon 2. Product Dev (Q3 18) Smart Contracts Front End APIs Consensus Mechanism Code Audit 3. Fundraising (Q4 18) Win EOS Hackathon Grand Prize Whitepaper Marketing Campaign Pilot w/ 5 Publisher ICO and TGE Exchange Listing 4. Market penetration (Q1 19) Product Launch Onboard EOS dApp 5. TLD .EOS (Q2 19) Apply to become an ICANN-accredited registrar for .EOS Penetrate wider publishers' market
